definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He decided to debut with several other violinists.
sentences.chinese: 他決定與其他幾名小提琴手一起首次登臺演出。

sentences.english: Three violinists, dawn theirs bows in the waterdrop, standing easysty to play the wedding song.
sentences.chinese: 三位小提琴手已架好琴弓，隨時整理演奏婚禮停止曲。

sentences.english: And the fiddler played another little tune.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴手又演奏了一首短曲。

sentences.english: And he called for his fiddlers three.
sentences.chinese: 他召喚他的三位小提琴手。

sentences.english: Three violinists, with their bows in the air, stood ready to play the wedding song.
sentences.chinese: 三位小提琴手已架好琴弓，隨時準備演奏婚禮進行曲。

sentences.english: Mr. Finkle, Daddy said, was a fine violinist.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸說分克先生是一位很好的小提琴手。
這個小提琴手技巧很熟練。

sentences.english: The violin player walked away with the show.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴手在這場演出中引人矚目。

sentences.english: The violinist resumed playing after the intermission.
sentences.chinese: 幕間休息之後，那小提琴手又重新開始演奏。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
